description: Engine temperature rises excessively due to coolant issues   radiator blockage   or malfunctioning thermostat   causing potential damage.
Brakes lose efficiency due to worn pads   leaking fluid   or malfunctioning calipers   increasing accident risk.
Tire loses air due to punctures   valve leaks   or wear   reducing vehicle stability and safety.
Battery discharges quickly because of electrical issues   parasitic drain   or old age   preventing vehicle start.
Automatic or manual transmission slips due to worn clutch or gearbox problems   causing erratic gear changes.
Fuel pump malfunction causes poor engine performance   stalling   or inability to start the vehicle.
Alternator stops charging battery properly   causing dim lights   electrical failures   and battery drain.
Worn or fouled spark plugs lead to misfires   poor fuel efficiency   and rough engine performance.
Steering becomes stiff or unresponsive due to power steering fluid leaks   worn linkages   or pump failure.
Worn shocks   struts   or bushings cause bouncy rides   poor handling   and uneven tire wear.
Damaged exhaust system causes noise   harmful emissions   and reduced engine efficiency.
Air conditioning stops cooling due to refrigerant leaks   compressor failure   or electrical issues.
Lights dim or fail because of blown bulbs   wiring issues   or alternator problems   reducing visibility.
Engine oil leaks from gaskets or seals   risking engine damage and fire hazards.
Broken or worn timing belt can cause severe engine damage and prevent starting.
Radiator blockage or coolant loss causes engine overheating and potential breakdown.
Misaligned wheels cause uneven tire wear   vibration   and steering problems.
Excessive smoke from engine due to oil burn   coolant leak   or fuel system issues.
Dirty or contaminated fuel affects engine performance   causing stalling or misfires.
Slipping clutch causes loss of acceleration and irregular gear engagement.
Engine loses power due to air filter   fuel   or ignition system issues.
Unusual knocking   rattling   or squealing indicates worn components or lubrication problems.
Uneven or rapid tire wear caused by poor alignment   suspension   or inflation issues.
Central or manual locks fail due to actuator or wiring problems.
Power windows stop working due to motor or switch failure.
Smell of fumes in cabin indicates leaks in exhaust or ventilation system.
Coolant leaks from hoses   radiator   or water pump   leading to overheating.
Difficulty in changing gears caused by transmission   clutch   or linkage issues.
Fuel level readings are unreliable due to faulty sender or gauge problems.
Anti-lock braking system malfunctions   reducing braking safety in slippery conditions.
Turbo fails to boost engine due to wear   oil issues   or mechanical failure.
Pre-ignition or detonation causes knocking   risking severe engine damage.
Squeaks or grinding in steering column due to worn joints or pump issues.
Clunks or rattles over bumps indicate worn suspension components.
Gasket failure causes coolant or oil mixing   leading to overheating and engine damage.
Illuminated warning light indicates various engine   emissions   or sensor issues.
Clogged fuel injectors reduce engine efficiency   cause misfires   and poor fuel economy.
Fan stops working due to electrical or motor issues   causing engine overheating.
Unusual whining or grinding from differential indicates worn gears or low lubrication.
Worn brake pads reduce stopping power and can damage rotors.
